intro: Sterculia quinqueloba, commonly known as the five-lobed sterculia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are palmately lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
